data.text: I'll spin up a team and hand this project to Thomas (PM) to scope and manage.

input.description: Define and document the shared design token consolidation plan — audit existing tokens across all tools, propose a single-source-of-truth CSS file structure, and document cross-project architectural patterns.

data.text: Now let me spawn Thomas to scope and manage this project.

input.prompt:
You have a new project to scope and manage.

## Project: Define and document the shared design token consolidation plan

**Brief:**
Define and document the shared design token consolidation plan — audit existing tokens across all tools, propose a single-source-of-truth CSS file structure, and document cross-project architectural patterns.

Owner: Andrei (Technical Architect)
Priority: high
Source: Charter Meeting #1

## Your Job

You are Thomas, the Product Manager. Scope this project:

1. First, explore the codebase to understand the current state of design tokens and CSS across all tools (landing page, OST tool, PDF tools, etc.)
2. Write requirements to `docs/design-token-consolidation-requirements.md`
3. Decide who to involve and in what order — this is primarily a technical architecture + design project, so Andrei and Robert are likely key players
4. Report back with your requirements and recommended team/phasing

Read the CLAUDE.md, your agent definition at `.claude/agents/product-manager.md`, and explore the codebase before writing requirements. Look at:
- `css/styles.css` (landing page styles)
- `ost-tool/client/src/` (OST tool styles)
- Any other CSS/style files across the repo
- Current design patterns and token usage

Make sure to understand the full scope before writing requirements.
input.name: pm

data.text:
Here's the status on the **Design Token Consolidation** project:

## What happened

Thomas (PM) was spawned and began exploring the codebase to audit existing design tokens and CSS across all tools (landing page, OST tool, etc.). However, it appears he was interrupted by the shutdown before completing the requirements document — `docs/design-token-consolidation-requirements.md` was **not written**.

## What needs to happen next

The team has been cleaned up. To move this project forward, we need to **re-run the pipeline**:

1. **Spawn a new team** and hand the project back to Thomas
2. Thomas explores the codebase, writes `docs/design-token-consolidation-requirements.md`
3. Andrei defines the technical approach in `docs/design-token-consolidation-tech-approach.md`
4. Robert specs the design token system in `docs/design-token-consolidation-design-spec.md`
5. Implementation follows the standard pipeline

Want me to kick this off again with a fresh team?
